Resources

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.16″ background_enable_color=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”2_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Title” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_font=”||||||||” text_text_color=”#4b858e” header_font=”|||on|||||” header_text_color=”#cccdce” header_font_size=”92px” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_3_font=”Zooja Pro|100|||||||” header_3_text_align=”center” header_3_text_color=”#cccdce” header_3_font_size=”93px” header_3_letter_spacing=”0.1px” header_3_line_height=”0.8em” custom_margin=”||0px|||” header_font_size_tablet=”80px” header_font_size_phone=”50px” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|desktop” header_3_font_size_tablet=”” header_3_font_size_phone=”77px” header_3_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Ngā Rauemi mo tātou! Some resources for us all!

 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Quote” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_font=”||||||||” text_text_color=”#BF9A46″ text_font_size=”24px” text_line_height=”1.5em” text_font_size_tablet=”21px” text_font_size_phone=”19px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

There are so many different resources on porn and young people on the internet now – and if you’re looking for some helpful resources, typing porn into your search bar may not take you to where you intended!

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text module_class=”col-quote-block” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]“They more we know about (porn) with accurate information, the better. We will make choices around sex anyway – so it’s better we are in a position where we can make educated choices. This way porn doesn’t become the only source of information about sex. ..because most of the time that’s the case.”
– Young person, TLP ITK survey[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_font_size=”21px” text_line_height=”1.5em” text_font_size_tablet=”19px” text_font_size_phone=”17px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_before=”width: 200px;||height: 399px;||content: ”;||background-image: url(/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/resources-doodle.png);||position: absolute;||left: -250px;||top: 26px;||background-size: cover;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

So we’ve created some resource lists with a selection of helpful books, research articles, websites, YouTube clips, guidelines and support services. These include resources for children, teens, whānau, parents, schools and health/youth service providers. This is a growing subject area with new resources and research coming out every year, so we’ll continue to update our resource content as this happens. We also don’t necessarily agree with 100% of what every contributor says, so take a “keep what you love, leave what you don’t” approach.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_image=”http://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/banner-image-2.jpg” To make sure our future generations have happy, healthy relationships, sexual or otherwise, it’s essential that we equip them with what they need to know.”[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ text_font_size=”14px” text_line_height=”1.4em” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”12px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

— Richie Hardcore, NZ Social Change campaigner

Kia ora and welcome! The young people of Aotearoa are facing a new pornography (porn) landscape, and with high exposure and unlimited access, porn is influencing youth sexual culture in new and diverse ways. Young people tell us they have varied views and sometimes concerning experiences around porn and that they need, and want, better conversations, information, and support.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.18.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”17px” text_line_height=”1.6em” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Youth and Porn Navigating the Issues has been developed to equip health professionals to better understand youth and porn issues and positively integrate this knowledge into their workplace practice. The kit includes 12 resources across three progressive skills. If you are new to this conversation, it can help to work through each skill, or if you are wanting specific information, please just head directly to the resource you need.

excerpt.rendered: ResourcesNgā Rauemi mo tātou! Some resources for us all!  There are so many different resources on porn and young people on the internet now – and if you’re looking for some helpful resources, typing porn into your search bar may not take you to where you intended!“They more we know about (porn) with accurate information, the […]
